p: To determine the amount of the major sesquiterpenoids ( 1– 4) in our extract, an HPLC analysis was carried out. The percentage of each sesquiterpene is reported in Table 1. It is possible to notice that furanoeudesma-1,3-diene is the most abundant while no furanodienone was detected in our extracts. Our results are in good agreement with those found by Marongiu et al. [ 12] who obtained supercritical fluid extraction (SCFE) myrrh oil made up of the following main components: furanoeudesma-1,3-diene (26.2%), curzerene (9.7%), and β-elemene (3.0%) without detecting any amount of furanodienone. A run at low temperature was used for the HPLC analysis to isolate compound 3 given that it could not be separated from other compounds in the mixture at higher temperatures.
